channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.title: Frame of old roadworks sign left on grassy triangle of ground, 25th September
item.description:
Next to Berkhampstead Nursery, on a small patch of ground. Grassy patch where sign has been left is also unmown and very scruffy looking, with litter as well.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Copt Elm Road, Cheltenham

item.title: A large pot hole outside my house., 25th September
item.description:
I have a large pot hole outside my property on the pavement was created by a scaffolding lorry that was working for Bromford Housing. This was done a few years ago and I kept reporting it to Bromford. They have now told me to raise the issue with Highways so here it is. Kind regards John.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Binyon Road, Winchcombe, Winchcombe
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti on village sign, 25th September
item.description:
Graffiti has appeared overnight on the sign into our village. Apparently, just down the road, closer to Norton, there is swastika graffiti as well
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Leigh, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Offensive (hate) graffiti, 25th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gloucester Road, Norton, Tewkesbury

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2, Cheviot Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 25th September
item.description:
Please see email below. I think this is split responsibility between Highways (trees) and Ubico. Please can it be looked at? you mentioned concerns on pavement upkeep etc and I mentioned a large tree on the pavement at the corner of Monson Avenue and Clarence Square which, due to lack of maintenance at the base was becoming somewhat of a rubbish tip and home for 'dumping' of any unwanted garden waste, soil etc. I do realise costs and priorities on services for street maintenance but do feel this particular large beautiful tree is really becoming a rubbish tip as well as a dump for 'garden waste' the tree base gathers all sorts of rubbish including waste paper and tins etc. unsightly as this is, the pavement area is also being restricted as this area of rubbish increases! You asked if I still have photos to send to you. Sadly I couldn't find them on my phone at the time but have retaken some shots today in the hope you find this helpful in an aid to asking whoever is responsible for help to clear this mound of waste and help keep our pavements tidy. (Full email with photos attached)
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green or amber traffic light is not working problem, 25th September
